properties.description: Generic notebook for logging a step

source: Setup parameters. This is done in a notebook so the same interface can be used across both pipelines and notebooks

Stage="Start" #Valid values are Start, OnProgress, Fail, Warning, and Completion
PipelineName = "pln_horizon"
PipelineRunID = "5a550e61-0382-4ac8-b8eb-af731741b756"
Inserts = 0
Updates = 0
Deletes = 0
ErrorMessage = ''
StatusMessage = 'Loading relevant reps'
PipelineTriggerID = ''
PipelineTriggerName = ''
PipelineTriggerType = ''
PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName = ''
PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID = ''
PipelineExecutionTimeInSec = ''
StartTime1 = ''
EndTime1 = ''
ActivityType = 'Pipeline'

# Import necessary libraries
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
import pyspark.sql.functions
import time
from random import randint
Log based on stage of the process as necessary

#If we're dealing with a start of a process we only need to set the start time. The status message is hard coded to ensure this is always consistent
if f'{Stage}' == "Start":
    sql =   f"""
            SELECT
                (SELECT IFNULL(MAX(LogId), 0) FROM Logging.PIPELINE_LOGS) + 1 AS LogId
                ,"{PipelineName}" AS PipelineName                
                ,"{PipelineRunID}" AS PipelineRunID
                ,current_timestamp() AS StartTime
                ,NULL AS EndTime
                ,NULL AS DurationSeconds
                ,{Inserts} AS Inserts
                ,{Updates} AS Updates
                ,{Deletes} AS Deletes
                ,"{ErrorMessage}" AS ErrorMessage
                ,"Starting process" AS StatusMessage
                ,"{PipelineTriggerID}" AS PipelineTriggerID
                ,"{PipelineTriggerName}" AS PipelineTriggerName
                ,"{PipelineTriggerType}" AS PipelineTriggerType
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID
                ,"{PipelineExecutionTimeInSec}" AS PipelineExecutionTimeInSec
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS StartTime1
                ,"" AS EndTime1
                ,"{ActivityType}" AS ActivityType
            """

    df = session.sql(sql)
    save_to_delta_with_retry(df, "logging.pipeline_logs", 20)

#If we're dealing with an onprogress, we will use the status message to post additional info as necessary
if f'{Stage}' == "OnProgress":
    sql =   f"""
            SELECT
                (SELECT IFNULL(MAX(LogId), 0) FROM Logging.PIPELINE_LOGS) + 1 AS LogId
                ,"{PipelineName}" AS PipelineName                
                ,"{PipelineRunID}" AS PipelineRunID
                ,current_timestamp() AS StartTime
                ,NULL AS EndTime
                ,NULL AS DurationSeconds
                ,{Inserts} AS Inserts
                ,{Updates} AS Updates
                ,{Deletes} AS Deletes
                ,"{ErrorMessage}" AS ErrorMessage
                ,"{StatusMessage}" AS StatusMessage
                ,"{PipelineTriggerID}" AS PipelineTriggerID
                ,"{PipelineTriggerName}" AS PipelineTriggerName
                ,"{PipelineTriggerType}" AS PipelineTriggerType
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID
                ,"{PipelineExecutionTimeInSec}" AS PipelineExecutionTimeInSec
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS StartTime1
                ,"" AS EndTime1
                ,"{ActivityType}" AS ActivityType
            """
    df = session.sql(sql)
    save_to_delta_with_retry(df, "logging.pipeline_logs", 20)

#If we're dealing with a warning we'll set the start and end time to be the same as nothing has executed
if f'{Stage}' == "Warning":
    sql =   f"""
            SELECT
                (SELECT IFNULL(MAX(LogId), 0) FROM Logging.PIPELINE_LOGS) + 1 AS LogId
                ,"{PipelineName}" AS PipelineName                
                ,"{PipelineRunID}" AS PipelineRunID
                ,current_timestamp() AS StartTime
                ,current_timestamp() AS EndTime
                ,NULL AS DurationSeconds
                ,{Inserts} AS Inserts
                ,{Updates} AS Updates
                ,{Deletes} AS Deletes
                ,"{ErrorMessage}" AS ErrorMessage
                ,"{StatusMessage}" AS StatusMessage
                ,"{PipelineTriggerID}" AS PipelineTriggerID
                ,"{PipelineTriggerName}" AS PipelineTriggerName
                ,"{PipelineTriggerType}" AS PipelineTriggerType
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID
                ,"{PipelineExecutionTimeInSec}" AS PipelineExecutionTimeInSec
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS StartTime1
                ,"" AS EndTime1
                ,"{ActivityType}" AS ActivityType
            """
    df = session.sql(sql)
    save_to_delta_with_retry(df, "logging.pipeline_logs", 20)

#If we're dealing with a warning we'll set the start and end time to be the same as nothing has executed
if f'{Stage}' == "Fail":
    sql =   f"""
            SELECT
                (SELECT IFNULL(MAX(LogId), 0) FROM Logging.PIPELINE_LOGS) + 1 AS LogId
                ,"{PipelineName}" AS PipelineName                
                ,"{PipelineRunID}" AS PipelineRunID
                ,current_timestamp() AS StartTime
                ,current_timestamp() AS EndTime
                ,NULL AS DurationSeconds
                ,{Inserts} AS Inserts
                ,{Updates} AS Updates
                ,{Deletes} AS Deletes
                ,"{ErrorMessage}" AS ErrorMessage
                ,"{StatusMessage}" AS StatusMessage
                ,"{PipelineTriggerID}" AS PipelineTriggerID
                ,"{PipelineTriggerName}" AS PipelineTriggerName
                ,"{PipelineTriggerType}" AS PipelineTriggerType
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID
                ,"{PipelineExecutionTimeInSec}" AS PipelineExecutionTimeInSec
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS StartTime1
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS EndTime1
                ,"{ActivityType}" AS ActivityType
            """
    df = session.sql(sql)
    save_to_delta_with_retry(df, "logging.pipeline_logs", 20)

#If we're dealing with a warning we'll set the start and end time to be the same as nothing has executed
if f'{Stage}' == "Completion":
    sql =   f"""
            SELECT
                (SELECT IFNULL(MAX(LogId), 0) FROM Logging.PIPELINE_LOGS) + 1 AS LogId
                ,PipelineName                
                ,PipelineRunID
                ,StartTime
                ,current_timestamp() AS EndTime
                ,cast(current_timestamp()-StartTime AS int) AS DurationSeconds
                ,{Inserts} AS Inserts
                ,{Updates} AS Updates
                ,{Deletes} AS Deletes
                ,"{ErrorMessage}" AS ErrorMessage
                ,"Complete: {StatusMessage}" AS StatusMessage
                ,"{PipelineTriggerID}" AS PipelineTriggerID
                ,"{PipelineTriggerName}" AS PipelineTriggerName
                ,"{PipelineTriggerType}" AS PipelineTriggerType
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineName
                ,"{PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID}" AS PipelineTriggeredbyPipelineRunID
                ,"{PipelineExecutionTimeInSec}" AS PipelineExecutionTimeInSec
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS StartTime1
                ,CAST(current_timestamp() AS varchar(8000)) AS EndTime1
                ,"{ActivityType}" AS ActivityType
            FROM
                logging.pipeline_logs
            WHERE
                PipelineRunID = "{PipelineRunID}"
                AND ActivityType = "Pipeline"
                AND StatusMessage = "{StatusMessage}"
            """
    df = session.sql(sql)
    save_to_delta_with_retry(df, "logging.pipeline_logs", 20)
